bibl.title: Letter from Helen Wheeler to Philip Showalter Hench, March 14, 1941

div1.p: Wheeler thanks Hench for the items he sent her concerning yellow fever.

div1.head: Letter from Helen Wheeler to Philip Showalter Hench, March 14, 1941
div1.opener:
THE JOHNS HOPKINS UNIVERSITY
WELCH MEDICAL LIBRARY
1900 EAST MONUMENT STREET
BALTIMORE, MD.
March 14, 1941.
Dr. Philip S. Hench
Mayo Clinic
Rochester, Minn.
Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Thank you very much for the items
on yellow fever which you so kindly sent us.
I am glad to know that Dr. Lazear's case of
the disease was experimentally contracted
after all, as that seems much more in keeping
with everything else that we know about him.

If you expect to be in Havana for
some time it might be well if you would leave
our material on yellow fever where someone
in Rochester can find it in case we have a
call for it here during your absence. Other-
wise we are glad for you to keep it as long
as you need it.
div1.closer:
Sincerely yours Helen Wheeler,
For the Librarian HW
